name: Archibald At the Charles Bridge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great service, old, clean and charming rooms. Beds a bit hard though. Back of the hotel was next to the river. Excellent breakfast, which we had outdoors every morning. I am unsure about the value for money, but apart from the beds we had nothing to complain about
reviews.title: Cozy and a stones throw from Charles bridge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of those hotels where everything was great-One could not fault anything.All reception staff were very helpful & friendly.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: Location is perfect=1minute to Charles Bridge , but yet so quiet.
reviews.title: Great hotel, close to everything

reviews.text: Highly recommend
reviews.title: Best Place in Prague

reviews.text: A group of friends traveling together spent three nights at this great little hotel in early July. We couldn't have been more pleased. The location was impossible to beat. You could see Castle Hill and the Charles Bridge from the hotel and virtually everything was within walking distance. The hotel itself was also superb. The rooms were clean and large and apparently the windows were soundproof because when they were closed you heard nothing from outside. The breakfast (included) was a buffet of typical European foods. Good and good choices. But one of the best things was the attitude of the staff. They were so helpful with every request. If you wanted to use the subway, specific and clear directions were given. Looking for a specific tour? They knew them all. They helped arrange dinner reservations for 10 on the evening we arrived and had suggestions for everything. Marek, especially was good. Other hotels should send their staff to him for training on how to treat their guests. The young lady (her name slips my mind) who helped us plan our stay was also wonderful. Transportation between the airport and hotel was available and punctual. We will all stay here again when we return to Praha!
reviews.title: Quality rooms, friendly staff, superb location

reviews.text: I visited Prague for the first time with my sister, and I could not have picked a better hotel. The location is perfect for all the sites, the rooms are spacious and comfortable, the breakfast is delicious and the hotel itself is impeccably maintained. The icing on the cake was our front desk
reviews.title: A Bohemian Treasure!

reviews.text: Manager Marek (Mark). He was professional, courteous , extremely helpful in every possible way and made us feel special. I do not think I have ever received such a high level of service as he provided. We had a great time, overall excellent experience!
reviews.title: Best hotel ever !!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's by far the best hotel stay I've ever had !!!! And the best experience I've had. They are almost like friends. Every question is responded with care, and they are knowledgeable! When I left, I was sad. The location is perfect, the center of the city is 10-15 at foot, crossing Charles Bridge...The food is awesome, loved the breakfest and I ate often in the evening there. Also, the staff are all attentive whereas it's Ondrej, Marek or Mario. The rooms are large, this hotel simply put is a GEM ! The staff is always caring, it shows why they won a price at trip advisor, when I'll get back to Prague it's no brainer, I'll be staying at Charles Bridge. And if you'd like to do the same then book in advance, because they are popular! Indulge yourself, Praha : Mam te rad !!!! Cheers from Québec!
reviews.title: An oasis.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a perfect choice. It is within walking distance from everything you would want to see (the Charles bridge, town square etc.) and a metro station, making traveling around the city or to the airport a breeze.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Very friendly staff and exelent food (both the restaurant and breakfast). The most amazing thing about the hotel is how calm and quiet the area is during the night. Perfect after walking around the city all day long. Great value for money and suited for everyone (especielly couples of all ages, families and friends), who does not go to this beautiful city solely for the purpose of partying all night long.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel! Highly recommend it!

reviews.text: A fantastically situated hotel very close to the famous Charles bridge with lovely views of the river , we were fortunate to have a lovely large room (21) with extra large bed, very good selection for breakfast to suit everyone. Friendly helpful staff .
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel set in quiet courtyard overlooking the river, very picturesque. Inside did not disappoint, with wooden flooring, plenty duvets and blankets, and a lovely leather couch to relax on. Our room was on top floor and staying in February, there were flurries of snow coating the rooftops, so we were happy with the warmth in the hotel. Bathroom was small, but had everything we needed, with a good shower and ample hot water. Only negative was the sachets of bath products, would have been nice to have a few more or better quality. Breakfast was fine, plenty hot and cold selections, cold meats and cheeses, however no fruit to speak of. Also Coffee was from a dispenser machine, when fresh would have been nicer. Staff were efficient and helpful. I hope yo be back in this wonderful city again soon, and this hotel would be my first choice.
reviews.title: Perfect City Break
Great stay
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights, every thing was very good, this was our second time staying in Prague, the fist stay was at the aria hotel which was outstanding but expensive, this hotel for the price we payed was excellent, good buffet breakfast,good cosy clean rooms, very helpful staff and a great location, no complaints at all.

This quaint hotel is located on a small side street next to the Charles Bridge. It is within walking distance of Prague Castle and the Old Town Square. Because the hotel is on off the main streets, you will avoid most of the crowds.
reviews.title: The Perfect Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The interior of the hotel is simple but clean. I woudl suggest a room on the top floor facing the river. The exposed wooden beams and traditional European beds give the rooms a cozy feel.
reviews.title: Great location! Honest and committed staff!

reviews.text: The room had two bedrooms, good for families. Very nice view of the river from the room.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Nice beds, bathroom and AC in both rooms. Great breakfast in the cozy cellar.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located on Kampa Island, the prettiest place in Prague and close to all the sights.
reviews.title: Lovely break at the Archibald

reviews.text: We paid 110 euro a day for this room, incl. Breakfast.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: Great hotel, good location close to Charles Bridge but away from the bustle of the main tourist area.
reviews.title: Excellent

aka: Archibald u Karlova Mostu (At The Charles Bridge) Hotel Prague
